newsitem.title: UK: Glaxo leads sector lower after ADRs slump.
newsitem.headline: Glaxo leads sector lower after ADRs slump.

text.p: Shares in major UK pharmaceutical firms were indicated lower in pre-market dealings after their ADRs slumped in New York overnight.
At 0808 GMT, shares in Glaxo Wellcome were marked down 11p to 927-1/2p after their ADRs fell $3/8 to $30-3/4.
Shares in Zeneca Group were indicated 5-1/2p lower at 1588-1/2p after Zeneca's ADRs shed $1 to $79, while shares in SmithKline Beecham eased 9p to 802-1/2p after their ADRs slipped $5/8 to $66-1/2.
"The currency doesn't help, and the way the ADRs are priced gives them an additional knock," said one market maker.
Glaxo shares, under the additional weight of a series of recent broker downgrades, stand at their lowest level since early September.
